20101221210700.000|20101221210702.000|TR0|Flight 103, most of them Americans, when a

20101221210704.000|20101221210707.000|TR0|that number, 11 people in the town of 
20101221210707.000|20101221210709.000|TR0|Lockerbie died when the wreckage smashed 
20101221210709.000|20101221210711.000|TR0|there on to the ground.  And only one man 
20101221210711.000|20101221210713.000|TR0|has ever been convicted of a crime related 
20101221210713.000|20101221210716.000|TR0|to that Lockerbie bombing.
20101221210716.000|20101221210718.000|TR0|
20101221210718.000|20101221210720.000|TR0|He's a Libyan man released from prison 
20101221210720.000|20101221210722.000|TR0|just last year on humanitarian grounds.  
20101221210722.000|20101221210725.000|TR0|And the reason given was he wasn't 
20101221210725.000|20101221210727.000|TR0|expected to survive more than three months

20101221210759.000|20101221210801.000|TR0|Lockerbie Bomber."

20101221210810.000|20101221210812.000|TR0|He had cancer, wasn't expected to live as 
20101221210812.000|20101221210814.000|TR0|I said past three months.  But based upon

20101221210817.000|20101221210819.000|TR0|al-Megrahi was as sick as Scottish doctors

20101221210823.000|20101221210826.000|TR0|SEN. ROBERT MENENDEZ (D), NEW JERSEY:  
20101221210826.000|20101221210828.000|TR0|Well, he was found -- he was convicted.  
20101221210828.000|20101221210830.000|TR0|And his appeal was denied.     And the 
20101221210830.000|20101221210832.000|TR0|bottom line is, is that, as our report 
20101221210832.000|20101221210835.000|TR0|elicits from medical cancer experts, that 
20101221210835.000|20101221210837.000|TR0|there's no way that a three-month 
20101221210837.000|20101221210839.000|TR0|prognosis could have been given, that he 
20101221210839.000|20101221210841.000|TR0|would only live three months.
20101221210841.000|20101221210844.000|TR0|
20101221210844.000|20101221210846.000|TR0|Every expert that came before the Senate 
20101221210846.000|20101221210848.000|TR0|Foreign Relations Committee, of which I 
20101221210848.000|20101221210851.000|TR0|conducted a hearing, even the Scottish 
20101221210851.000|20101221210853.000|TR0|experts that were used would not commit to 
20101221210853.000|20101221210855.000|TR0|a three-month period.  And that's what was 
20101221210855.000|20101221210857.000|TR0|necessary to get compassionate release.  
20101221210857.000|20101221210900.000|TR0|So, this was a medically unjustified 
20101221210900.000|20101221210902.000|TR0|decision.  It was manipulated in order to 
20101221210902.000|20101221210904.000|TR0|have al-Megrahi freed to Gadhafi, who made 
20101221210904.000|20101221210906.000|TR0|it his number-one priority.
20101221210906.000|20101221210909.000|TR0|
20101221210909.000|20101221210911.000|TR0|And Libya and Gadhafi used enormous 
20101221210911.000|20101221210913.000|TR0|political and commercial pressure to get 
20101221210913.000|20101221210915.000|TR0|al-Megrahi released.  And instead of 
20101221210915.000|20101221210918.000|TR0|sitting in a jail, he now sits in a luxury 
20101221210918.000|20101221210920.000|TR0|villa in Libya.  And that's why we 
20101221210920.000|20101221210922.000|TR0|consider it justice undone.

20101221210924.000|20101221210927.000|TR0|BALDWIN:  Senator Menendez, I want to talk 
20101221210927.000|20101221210929.000|TR0|a little bit more about those doctors.

20101221210931.000|20101221210933.000|TR0|he had three months to live.

20101221210938.000|20101221210940.000|TR0|release because he had prostate cancer.

20101221210942.000|20101221210945.000|TR0|were doctors who were -- quote -- "clearly

20101221213947.000|20101221213949.000|TR0|isn't this entrapment?  Well, the sheriff 
20101221213949.000|20101221213952.000|TR0|has maintained that this was a guy who was 
20101221213952.000|20101221213954.000|TR0|selling this gook on Amazon.com while 
20101221213954.000|20101221213956.000|TR0|Amazon was actually offering this book for 
20101221213956.000|20101221213958.000|TR0|sale.  He was out there peddling the book 
20101221213958.000|20101221214001.000|TR0|to anybody who wanted to buy it.
20101221214001.000|20101221214003.000|TR0|
20101221214003.000|20101221214005.000|TR0|So, they said that's not going to be a 
20101221214005.000|20101221214008.000|TR0|defense in this case.  And they also say 
20101221214008.000|20101221214010.000|TR0|that those people that want to hide under 
20101221214010.000|20101221214012.000|TR0|First Amendment, freedom of speech, they 
20101221214012.000|20101221214014.000|TR0|say, the sheriff argues that, you know, 
20101221214014.000|20101221214017.000|TR0|this is no different when you walk in to a 
20101221214017.000|20101221214019.000|TR0|theater, you can't yell "fire" or yell 
20101221214019.000|20101221214021.000|TR0|"bomb" on an airplane.  There are certain 
20101221214021.000|20101221214023.000|TR0|things that you can't do.
20101221214023.000|20101221214026.000|TR0|
20101221214026.000|20101221214028.000|TR0|Again, this is a Florida law.  It might be 
20101221214028.000|20101221214030.000|TR0|different in some other states.  And they 
20101221214030.000|20101221214032.000|TR0|say this is a law that pertains to obscene 
20101221214032.000|20101221214035.000|TR0|materials, not pornography.  That's going 
20101221214035.000|20101221214037.000|TR0|to be a big difference in this case.  So, 
20101221214037.000|20101221214039.000|TR0|they say -- and they believe that their 
20101221214039.000|20101221214041.000|TR0|case is pretty locked tight.
20101221214041.000|20101221214044.000|TR0|
20101221214044.000|20101221214046.000|TR0|BALDWIN:  Bottom line here is sticking to 
20101221214046.000|20101221214048.000|TR0|his freedom of speech no matter how 
20101221214048.000|20101221214050.000|TR0|disgusting the rest of us may find his

20101221214941.000|20101221214943.000|TR0|rules, until now. The Federal 
20101221214943.000|20101221214946.000|TR0|Communications Commission, FCC, has now 
20101221214946.000|20101221214948.000|TR0|approved the first set of rules designed 
20101221214948.000|20101221214950.000|TR0|to guarantee net neutrality.
20101221214950.000|20101221214953.000|TR0|
20101221214953.000|20101221214955.000|TR0|What does that mean?  Ali Velshi explains.
20101221214955.000|20101221214957.000|TR0|
20101221214957.000|20101221214959.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)      ALI VELSHI, CNN 
20101221214959.000|20101221215002.000|TR0|CHIEF BUSINESS CORRESPONDENT:  The 
20101221215002.000|20101221215004.000|TR0|Internet comes to you through a pipe like 
20101221215004.000|20101221215006.000|TR0|this.  Right now, it's a fairly good sized 
20101221215006.000|20101221215008.000|TR0|pipe.  And everything that goes through 
20101221215008.000|20101221215011.000|TR0|the pipe is equal.
20101221215011.000|20101221215013.000|TR0|
20101221215013.000|20101221215015.000|TR0|So if you're tweeting, it goes through 
20101221215015.000|20101221215017.000|TR0|that pipe.  If you're watching -- if 
20101221215017.000|20101221215020.000|TR0|you're Skyping with somebody, it goes 
20101221215020.000|20101221215022.000|TR0|through that pipe.  If you're looking at 
20101221215022.000|20101221215024.000|TR0|pictures on Facebook, it goes through that 
20101221215024.000|20101221215026.000|TR0|pipe.
20101221215026.000|20101221215029.000|TR0|
20101221215029.000|20101221215031.000|TR0|Now, watching video on YouTube, goes 
20101221215031.000|20101221215033.000|TR0|through that same pipe.  And if you're 
20101221215033.000|20101221215035.000|TR0|streaming videos from Netflix, it all goes 
20101221215035.000|20101221215038.000|TR0|through that pipe.
20101221215038.000|20101221215040.000|TR0|
20101221215040.000|20101221215042.000|TR0|Generally speaking, the pipe is pretty 
20101221215042.000|20101221215044.000|TR0|good.  It all gets through there and 
20101221215044.000|20101221215047.000|TR0|through to the other side.
20101221215047.000|20101221215049.000|TR0|
20101221215049.000|20101221215051.000|TR0|Now, here's what some people are 
20101221215051.000|20101221215054.000|TR0|suggesting might happen, that if there's a 
20101221215054.000|20101221215056.000|TR0|two-tiered system, there'll be this big 
20101221215056.000|20101221215058.000|TR0|pipe if you are going to have services 
20101221215058.000|20101221215100.000|TR0|that use a lot of that video, and then 
20101221215100.000|20101221215103.000|TR0|there'll be a smaller pipe like this one, 
20101221215103.000|20101221215105.000|TR0|that's for things that use less.  And 
20101221215105.000|20101221215107.000|TR0|clearly, it's a little harder to get some 
20101221215107.000|20101221215109.000|TR0|of that big bandwidth stuff into that 
20101221215109.000|20101221215112.000|TR0|little pipe.
20101221215112.000|20101221215114.000|TR0|
20101221215114.000|20101221215116.000|TR0|So, if I want to just surf the Web and 
20101221215116.000|20101221215118.000|TR0|write e-mails, I probably just need this 
20101221215118.000|20101221215121.000|TR0|smaller pipe.  But if I'm going to do what 
20101221215121.000|20101221215123.000|TR0|we increasingly do these days, watch more 
20101221215123.000|20101221215125.000|TR0|video and have richer content, I'm going 
20101221215125.000|20101221215127.000|TR0|to need that larger pipe, and some people 
20101221215127.000|20101221215130.000|TR0|say you should have to pay for that.  
20101221215130.000|20101221215132.000|TR0|You'll get better access, so pay for it.  
20101221215132.000|20101221215134.000|TR0|Some say the division is censorship and 
20101221215134.000|20101221215136.000|TR0|will kill innovation in this country.
20101221215136.000|20101221215139.000|TR0|
20101221215139.000|20101221215141.000|TR0|A lot of interesting arguments on both 
20101221215141.000|20101221215143.000|TR0|sides of this.
20101221215143.000|20101221215145.000|TR0|
20101221215145.000|20101221215148.000|TR0|(END VIDEOTAPE)
